title: Anti-Abortion PACs Spent $1.1 Million In Just Four Weeks Backing Herschel Walker
description: Anti-abortion groups are backing the Georgia Republican running for Senate despite a report last month that he encouraged and paid for his girlfriend to get an abortion.
text_headers: Anti-Abortion PACs Spent $1.1 Million In Just Four Weeks Backing Herschel Walker

News broke last month that Georgia Republican Herschel Walker not only encouraged his girlfriend to get an abortion, but he also paid for it. Since then, anti-abortion PACs have thrown $1.1 million behind his Senate run.


Most of Walker’s support has come from Women Speak Out, according to records filed with the Federal Election Commission. That super PAC, which is affiliated with the nonprofit Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America, has spent $989,000 boosting Walker or opposing his rival, Sen. Raphael Warnock (D-Ga.), since Oct. 4. It has paid for digital ads, door hangers, canvassing and mailers.

The National Right to Life Committee’s victory fund dropped $98,000 on ads backing Walker. The PAC for the nonprofit National Pro-Life Alliance donated $5,000 directly to Walker’s campaign.

Spokespeople for the organizations did not immediately respond to inquiries. Shortly after the allegations about Walker broke, a spokesperson for Women Speak Out said it was standing by the football star-turned-Senate candidate. “Herschel Walker has denied these allegations in the strongest possible terms, and we stand firmly alongside him,” said Mallory Carroll, a vice president of Susan B. Anthony Pro-life America and spokeswoman for Women Speak Out. “To date, our Georgia field team has visited more than 310,000 homes across the state in support of pro-life candidates like Herschel and against the extremism of Sen. Warnock and Stacey Abrams, and we will continue through Election Day.”
On Oct. 25, the National Right to Life Victory Fund began running this ad on Facebook touting Herschel Walker's position on abortion.Facebook/National Right to Life VIctory Fund
